title: Addition is Associative
description:
Prove that addition of natural numbers is associative: `(n + m) + p = n + (m + p)`.

**Goal:** `forall n m p : nat, (n + m) + p = n + (m + p)`

This is a fundamental property of natural number addition. You'll need induction on one of the arguments.
hints: The base case (n = 0) should simplify directly with `simpl` and `reflexivity`
For the inductive case, `simpl` will reduce `S n' + m + p` and `S n' + (m + p)`, then use `rewrite IHn'`
template:
Theorem plus_assoc : forall n m p : nat, (n + m) + p = n + (m + p).
Proof.
  (* Your proof here *)
Admitted.
solution:
Theorem plus_assoc : forall n m p : nat, (n + m) + p = n + (m + p).
Proof.
  intros n m p.
  induction n as [| n' IHn'].
  - simpl. reflexivity.
  - simpl. rewrite IHn'. reflexivity.
Qed.
